summary: Build a customer-facing website for Makana Man (premium healthy, high-protein snacks for all ages).

existing_features.title: Create a customer-facing marketing website for “Makana Packet” with a clear navigation and the following pages/sections: Home (hero + value proposition), Packets/Products (list of available packets with details), About (brand story), and Contact (inquiry form + business contact info).

Implement inquiry submission so customer messages from the Contact form are stored in the Motoko backend and can be retrieved by an admin-only view in the frontend (simple passwordless gating is acceptable if Internet Identity is not configured yet).

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) appropriate for a customer-facing brand site for Makana Packet, and keep styling consistent across all pages (do not use a blue/purple theme).

Add basic SEO and usability essentials: page titles, meta description defaults, accessible headings, keyboard-navigable menu, and a responsive layout that passes a basic accessibility check (labels on form fields, sufficient contrast, focus states).
Render generated brand images as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the Home hero and Packets/Products section.

Rename the customer-facing brand/site name from “Makana Packet” to “Makana Man” across the frontend UI, including the header logo text, logo alt text, footer branding, and any other visible occurrences.

Update customer-facing marketing copy to describe Makana Man as premium quality snacks that are healthy, high-protein, and suitable for all ages, replacing existing “gift packets” positioning on the main marketing pages.
Update SEO-facing page titles to use “Makana Man” and reflect the snacks positioning (premium healthy high-protein snacks) on Home, About, Packets, and Contact pages.

Update the static product list content currently defined as “packets” so that the displayed items and descriptions are written as premium healthy snack products (high-protein) rather than gift packets, while keeping the existing route/path and image asset references intact.
